intro: Coccoloba pendula, commonly known as the weeping coccoloba, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, pendulous inflorescences that resemble weeping willows. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, drooping spikes. Coccoloba pendula is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to tropical and subtropical climates.
